member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextParagraphFormat.ListLevelIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the list level index used with paragraphs.
member.returns:
The list level index. It can be a value of 0 or higher, as described in the following table.
ValueMeaning
0No list.
1First-level (outermost) list.
2Second-level (nested) list. This is nested under a level 1 list item.
3Third-level (nested) list. This is nested under a level 2 list item.
And so onNesting continues similarly.
Up to three levels are common in HTML documents.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange
member.summary: Represents a span of continuous text in a document, and provides powerful editing and data-binding properties and methods that allow an app to select, examine, and change document text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.CanPaste(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the Clipboard contains content that can be pasted, using a specified format, into the current text range.
member.param: The clipboard format. Zero represents the best format, which usually is Rich Text Format (RTF), but CF_UNICODETEXT and other formats are also possible. The default value is zero.
member.returns: True if the Clipboard content can be pasted into the text range in the specified format, and otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.ChangeCase(Microsoft.UI.Text.LetterCase)
member.summary: Changes the case of letters in a text range.
member.param: The new case of letters in the text range. The default value is Lower.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.Collapse(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Collapses the text range into a degenerate point at either the beginning or end of the range.
member.param: True collapses at the start of the text range, and false collapses at the end of the range. The default value is true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.Copy
member.summary: Copies the text of the text range to the Clipboard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.Cut
member.summary: Moves the text of the text range to the Clipboard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.Delete(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes text from the text range.
member.param: The unit of text to delete.
The number of units to delete. See Remarks.
member.returns: The number of units deleted. Deleting the text in a nondegenerate text range counts as one unit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.EndOf(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves or extends the text range to the end of the nearest specified text unit. The text range is moved or extended forward in the document.
member.param: The unit by which to move the end position of the text range.

True extends the text range by moving just the end position of the range to the end of the specified unit. False moves both ends of the text range to the end of the specified unit. The default value is false.
member.returns: The number of character positions that the range was moved or extended, plus 1 if the text range collapsed to the start of the range. If the text range includes the final carriage return (CR) at the end of the story, and extend is false, the return value is set to –1 to indicate that the collapse occurred before the end of the range. This is because an insertion point cannot exist beyond the final CR.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.Expand(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit)
member.summary: Expands a text range to completely contain any partial text units.
member.param: The text unit to use to expand the range. The default value is Word.
member.returns: The number of characters added to the text range, if the range was expanded to include a partially contained unit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.FindText(System.String,System.Int32,Microsoft.UI.Text.FindOptions)
member.summary: Searches for a particular text string in a range and, if found, selects the string.
member.param: The text string to search for.
The maximum number of characters to search. It can be one of the following.
The options to use when doing the text search.
member.returns: The length of the matching text string, or zero if no matching string is found.

member.summary: Retrieves the Unicode Transformation Format (UTF)-32 character code of the character at the specified offset from the end of the text range.
member.param: The character value.

The offset from the end of the text range.
| If offset is | The method returns this character | |---|---| | 0 | The character at the end of the range | | in the middle of a surrogate pair | The corresponding UTF-32 character |

member.summary: Creates a new object that is identical to this text range object.
member.returns: The duplicate text range object.

member.summary: Determines whether this range is in or at the same text as a specified range.
member.param: Text that is compared to the current range.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.InsertImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.UI.Text.VerticalCharacterAlignment,System.String,Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream)
member.summary: Inserts an image into this range.
member.param: The width of the image, in Device-independent pixels (DIPs).
The height of the image, in DIPs.

If verticalAlign is Baseline, this parameter is the distance, in DIPs, that the top of the image extends above the text baseline. If verticalAlign is Baseline and ascent is zero, the bottom of the image is placed at the text baseline.
The vertical alignment of the image.
The alternate text for the image.
The stream that contains the image data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.InStory(Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange)
member.summary: Determines whether this range's story is the same as a specified range's story.
member.param: The ITextRange object whose story is compared to this range's story.
member.returns: The comparison result. The result can be null. The method returns True if this range's story is the same as that of the ITextRange; otherwise it returns False.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.IsEqual(Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange)
member.summary: Determines whether this range has the same character positions and story as those of a specified range.
member.param: The text range to compare to this text range.
member.returns: True if this text range has the same character positions and story as range, and otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.MatchSelection
member.summary: Sets the start and end positions of this range to match the active selection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.Move(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point forward or backward by the specified number of units. If the text range is nondegenerate, it is collapsed to an insertion point at the start or end position of the text range, depending on count, and then is moved.
member.param: The units to move the insertion point. The default value is Character.

The number of units to move the insertion point. The default value is 1. If count is greater than zero, the insertion point moves forward, toward the end of the story. If count is less than zero, the insertion point moves backward, toward the beginning of the story. If count is zero, the range is unchanged.
member.returns: The actual number of units the insertion point moves. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.MoveEnd(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the end position of the text range.
member.param: The unit by which to move the end position of the text range. The default value is Character.

The number of units to move the end position of the text range. The default value is 1. If count is greater than zero, the end position moves forward, toward the end of the story. If count is less than zero, the end position move backward, toward the beginning of the story. If count is zero, the end position does not move.
member.returns: The actual number of units that the end position of the text range moved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.MoveStart(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the start position of a text range.
member.param: The unit by which to move the start position of the text range. The default value is Character.

The number of units to move the start position of the text range. The default value is 1. If count is greater than zero, the start position of the text range moves forward, toward the end of the story. If count is less than zero, the start position of the text range moves backward, toward the beginning of the story. If count is zero, the start position doesn't move.
member.returns: The actual number of units that the start position moved. The pointer can be NULL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.Paste(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pastes text from the Clipboard into the text range.
member.param: The clipboard format to use in the paste operation. Zero represents the best format, which usually is Rich Text Format (RTF), but CF_UNICODETEXT and other formats are also possible. The default value is zero.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.ScrollIntoView(Microsoft.UI.Text.PointOptions)
member.summary: Scrolls this text range into view.
member.param: The end of the text range to scroll into view. This function uses only the Start, NoHorizontalScroll, and NoVerticalScroll values of the PointOptions enumeration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.SetIndex(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the text range to the specified unit of the story.
member.param: The unit used to move the text range.

The index of the specified unit. The text range is relocated to the unit that has this index. If unit is positive, the numbering of units begins at the start of the story and proceeds forward. If negative, the numbering begins at the end of the story and proceeds backward. The start of the story corresponds to index = 1 for all existing units, and the last unit in the story corresponds to index = – 1.

Indicates how to change the text range. True extends the text range to include the unit by moving only the end position of the text range. False collapses the text range to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.SetPoint(Windows.Foundation.Point,Microsoft.UI.Text.PointOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the text range based on the specified point.
member.param: An ordered pair of floating-point x- and y-coordinates that defines a point in a two-dimensional plane.
The alignment type of the specified point.

Indicates how to set the endpoints of the text range. If extend is 0, the text range is an insertion point located at the specified point, or at the nearest point with selectable text. If extend is 1, the endpoint specified by options is moved to the point and the other endpoint is left alone. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.SetRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the endpoints of the text range to the specified values.
member.param: The character position for the start of the text range. This parameter must be less than endPosition.
The character position for the end of the text range.

member.summary: Replaces the text in the text range.
member.param: The conversion flags that control how the text is inserted in the text range.
The new text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextRange.StartOf(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves or extends the text range to the start of the nearest specified text unit. The text range is moved or extended backward in the document.
member.param: The unit by which to move the start position of the text range. The default value is Word.

True extends the text range by moving just the start position of the range to the start of the specified unit. False moves both ends of the text range to the start of the specified unit. The default value is false.
member.returns: The number of characters the insertion point or start position is moved. Note that this value is always less than or equal to zero, since the motion is always toward the beginning of the story.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextSelection.MoveDown(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point or the active end of the text selection down, mimicking the functionality of the Down Arrow or Page Down key.
member.param:
The units by which to move the insertion point or active end. The following values are valid.
ValueCorresponding key combinationMeaning
LineDown ArrowMoves down one line. This is the default.
ParagraphCtrl+Down ArrowMoves down one paragraph.
ScreenPage DownMoves down one screen.
WindowCtrl+Page DownMoves to the last character in the window.
The number of units to move. The default value is 1.

Indicates how to change the selection. True extends the selection by moving only the active end. False collapses the selection to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.
member.returns: The number of units that the insertion point or active end moved down. Collapsing the selection counts as one unit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextSelection.MoveLeft(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point or the active end of the text selection to the left, mimicking the functionality of the Left Arrow key.
member.param:
The units by which to move the insertion point or active end. The following values are valid.
ValueCorresponding key combinationMeaning
CharacterLeft ArrowMove one character position to the left. This is the default.
WordCtrl+Left ArrowMove one word to the left.
The number of units to move. The default value is 1. If count is less than zero, movement is to the right.

Indicates how to change the selection. True extends the selection by moving only the active end. False collapses the selection to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.
member.returns: The number of units that the insertion point or active end moved. Collapsing the selection counts as one unit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.ITextSelection.MoveRight(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

member.param:
The units by which to move the insertion point or active end. The following values are valid.
ValueCorresponding key combinationMeaning
CharacterRight ArrowMove one character position to the right. This is the default.
WordCtrl+Right ArrowMove one word to the right.
The number of units to move. The default value is 1. If count is less than zero, movement is to the left.

Indicates how to change the selection. True extends the selection by moving only the active end. False collapses the selection to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.
member.returns: The number of units that the insertion point or active end moved. Collapsing the selection counts as one unit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.RichEditTextRange.EndOf(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves or extends the text range to the end of the nearest specified text unit. The text range is moved or extended forward in the document.
member.param: The unit by which to move the end position of the text range.

true to extend the text range by moving just the end position of the range to the end of the specified unit. false to move both ends of the text range to the end of the specified unit. The default is false.
member.returns: The number of character positions that the range was moved or extended, plus 1 if the text range collapsed to the start of the range. If the text range includes the final carriage return (CR) at the end of the story, and extend is false, the return value is set to –1 to indicate that the collapse occurred before the end of the range. This is because an insertion point cannot exist beyond the final CR.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.RichEditTextRange.Move(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the insertion point forward or backward by the specified number of _unit_s. If the text range is nondegenerate, it is collapsed to an insertion point at the start or end position of the text range, depending on _count_, and then is moved.
member.param: The units to move the insertion point. The default value is Character.

The number of _unit_s to move the insertion point. The default value is 1. If _count_ is greater than zero, the insertion point moves forward, toward the end of the story. If _count_ is less than zero, the insertion point moves backward, toward the beginning of the story. If _count_ is zero, the range is unchanged.
member.returns: The actual number of units the insertion point moves.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.RichEditTextRange.MoveEnd(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the end position of the text range.
member.param: The unit by which to move the end position of the text range. The default value is Character.

The number of _unit_s to move the end position of the text range. The default value is 1. If _count_ is greater than zero, the end position moves forward, toward the end of the story. If _count_ is less than zero, the end position move backward, toward the beginning of the story. If _count_ is zero, the end position does not move.
member.returns: The actual number of _unit_s that the end position of the text range moved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.RichEditTextRange.MoveStart(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the start position of a text range.
member.param: The unit by which to move the start position of the text range. The default value is Character.

The number of _unit_s to move the start position of the text range. The default value is 1. If _count_ is greater than zero, the start position of the text range moves forward, toward the end of the story. If _count_ is less than zero, the start position of the text range moves backward, toward the beginning of the story. If _count_ is zero, the start position doesn't move.
member.returns: The actual number of _unit_s that the start position moved. The pointer can be null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.RichEditTextRange.ScrollIntoView(Microsoft.UI.Text.PointOptions)
member.summary: Scrolls this text range into view.
member.param: The end of the text range to scroll into view. This function uses only the Start, NoHorizontalScroll, and NoVerticalScroll values of the PointOptions enumeration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.RichEditTextRange.SetIndex(Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the text range to the specified unit of the story.
member.param: The unit used to move the text range.

The index of the specified unit. The text range is relocated to the unit that has this index. If unit is positive, the numbering of units begins at the start of the story and proceeds forward. If negative, the numbering begins at the end of the story and proceeds backward. The start of the story corresponds to index = 1 for all existing units, and the last unit in the story corresponds to index = – 1.

Indicates how to change the text range. True extends the text range to include the unit by moving only the end position of the text range. False collapses the text range to an insertion point and then moves the insertion point. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.RichEditTextRange.SetPoint(Windows.Foundation.Point,Microsoft.UI.Text.PointOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the text range based on the specified point.
member.param: An ordered pair of floating-point x- and y-coordinates that defines a point in a two-dimensional plane.
The alignment type of the specified _point_.

Indicates how to set the endpoints of the text range. If extend is 0, the text range is an insertion point located at the specified point, or at the nearest point with selectable text. If extend is 1, the endpoint specified by options is moved to the point and the other endpoint is left alone. The default is 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Text.RichEditTextRange.SetRange(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the endpoints of the text range to the specified values.
member.param: The character position for the start of the text range. This parameter must be less than _endPosition_.
The character position for the end of the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextGetOptions.AdjustCrlf
member.summary: If the starting character position is in the middle of a construct such as a CRLF (U+000D U+000A), surrogate pair, variation-selector sequence, or table-row delimiter, move to the beginning of the construct.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextGetOptions.AllowFinalEop
member.summary: Allow retrieving the final end-of-paragraph (EOP) if it's included in the range. This EOP exists in all rich-text controls and cannot be deleted. It does not exist in plain-text controls.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextGetOptions.FormatRtf
member.summary: Retrieve Rich Text Format (RTF) instead of plain text. Rich Text Format (RTF) is a BYTE (8-bit) format, but because GetText returns a string, the Rich Text Format (RTF) is returned as WCHARs (16-bit or UTF-16), not bytes, when you call GetText with the FormatRtf value. When you call ITextRange.SetText with FormatRtf, the method accepts an string containing either bytes or WCHARs, but other Rich Text Format (RTF) readers only understand bytes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextGetOptions.UseCrlf
member.summary: Use carriage return/line feed (CR/LF) in place of a carriage return.

member.summary: A text run of characters that all have identical paragraph formatting properties.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Section
member.summary: A section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Sentence
member.summary: A string of text that meets the following criteria: + Ends with a period, question mark, or exclamation mark. + Is followed by one or more ASCII white space characters (9 through 0xd and 0x20), or the Unicode paragraph separator (0x2029). The trailing white space is part of the sentence. + The last sentence in a story does not need to have a period, question mark, or exclamation mark. + Other sentences must follow a sentence end and cannot begin with a period, question mark, or exclamation mark. + The start of a story qualifies as the start of a Sentence, even if the string there doesn't qualify as a sentence grammatically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Shadow
member.summary: Shadow text.

member.summary: Text in small caps.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextRangeUnit.Story
member.summary: A story, which is a contiguous range of text in a document. For example, a story can contain one of the various parts of a document, such as the main text of a document, headers and footers, footnotes, or annotations. In a rich edit control, there is only one story per document, although a client can use multiple documents to represent multiple stories.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextSetOptions
member.summary: Specifies options for setting the text in a text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextSetOptions.ApplyRtfDocumentDefaults
member.summary: Apply the Rich Text Format (RTF) default settings for the document. Rich Text Format (RTF) often contains document default properties. These properties are typically ignored when inserting Rich Text Format (RTF) (as distinguished from opening an Rich Text Format (RTF) file).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextSetOptions.CheckTextLimit
member.summary: Obey the current text limit instead of increasing the limit to fit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextSetOptions.FormatRtf
member.summary: Treat input text as Rich Text Format (RTF) (the Rich Text Format (RTF) text will be validated).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextSetOptions.None
member.summary: No text setting option is specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextSetOptions.Unhide
member.summary: Don't insert as hidden text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextSetOptions.UnicodeBidi
member.summary: Use the Unicode bidirectional algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.TextSetOptions.Unlink
member.summary: Don't include text as part of a hyperlink.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType
member.summary: Specifies the type of character underlining.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.Dash
member.summary: A dashed line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.DashDot
member.summary: Alternating dashes and dots.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.DashDotDot
member.summary: Single dashes, each followed by two dots.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.Dotted
member.summary: A dotted line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.Double
member.summary: Two solid double lines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.DoubleWave
member.summary: Two wavy lines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.HeavyWave
member.summary: A thick wavy line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.LongDash
member.summary: Long dashes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.None
member.summary: Characters are not underlined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.Single
member.summary: A single solid line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.Thick
member.summary: A thick solid line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.ThickDash
member.summary: Thick dashes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.ThickDashDot
member.summary: Thick, alternating dashes and dots.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.ThickDashDotDot
member.summary: Thick single dashes, each followed by two thick dots.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.ThickDotted
member.summary: A thick dotted line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.ThickLongDash
member.summary: Thick long dashes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.Thin
member.summary: A thin solid line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.Undefined
member.summary: No underline type is defined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.Wave
member.summary: A wavy line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.UnderlineType.Words
member.summary: Underline words, but not the spaces between words.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Text.VerticalCharacterAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the vertical position of a character relative to a bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.VerticalCharacterAlignment.Baseline
member.summary: The character is positioned at the text baseline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.VerticalCharacterAlignment.Bottom
member.summary: The character is positioned at the bottom edge of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Text.VerticalCharacterAlignment.Top
member.summary: The character is positioned at the top edge of the bounding rectangle.
